node.title: New Zealand will begin to ease COVID border restrictions from January
node.alt: A man in a mask pushes a suitcase trolley at Sydney airport, in front of a sign with silver fern that says: "We've miss you".
node.description: Fully vaccinated New Zealanders in Australia will be able to travel to New Zealand without two weeks ofÂ quarantine from January 16, COVID-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says.
node.content: ["Fully vaccinated New Zealanders in Australia will be able to travel to New Zealand without a two-week\u00a0quarantine period\u00a0from January 16, COVID-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins has said.", "Mr Hipkins has outlined a staged reopening of international borders, with\u00a0foreign travellers who are fully vaccinated against COVID\u00a0able to enter the country from April 30.", "Fully vaccinated New Zealanders and other eligible travellers from all other countries could start travelling to New Zealand without quarantine from February\u00a013, Mr Hipkins said.\u00a0", "However, Mr Hipkins said\u00a0there would be a mandatory 7-day self-isolation period\u00a0for those who were not required to enter quarantine.", "He said all travellers will also\u00a0require a negative pre-departure test, proof of vaccination and a declaration that they had not been in a very high-risk country in the past 14 days.", "The move\u00a0eases\u00a0border restrictions\u00a0that have been in place since the pandemic hit in March\u00a0last year.", "More to come."]
